turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Bavarian S 3/6.
turn.2: Of the 20 planned locomotives of series n, Maffei could only deliver 2 engines (18 529 and 530) before it went bankrupt.
turn.3: Who or what are the other engines?
turn.4: Henschel took over the order and supplied the rest of the 18 engines in 1930/31 as series o (18 531–548).
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: The last 11 locos of this series were given a newly developed tender with the designation 2'2' T 31.7. No. 18 528 is preserved and stood as a memorial in front of the HQ building of the former Krauss-Maffei company in Munich.
turn.8: The locomotive is now in a shelter in the grounds of the Allach factory, following the takeover of the former Krauss Maffei Transport Technology by Siemens, and is not accessible to the public.
turn.10: In the 1950s a large part of the Deutsche Bundesbahn's vehicle fleet underwent modernisation.
turn.12: As a result, 30 Class 18.5 engines were rebuilt by the firms of Krauss-Maffei and Henschel.
